text: St Aidan's Theological College, Ballarat was an Australian educational institution, started in 1903,VHD heritage council to train clergy to serve in the Church of England in Australia. The Age, Melbourne, 29 November 1932. p. 7. Principals included Arthur Winnington-Ingram, later the Archdeacon of Hereford,thePeerage.com and former students Brian Macdonald, an assistant bishop of Perth, Western Australia.Crockford's Clerical Directory, 1980-82, p. 636 London: Oxford University Press, 1983 It closed in 1932.ballarat.vic.gov ==References== Category:Anglican seminaries and theological colleges Category:Former theological colleges in Australia Category:Education in Ballarat Category:1903 establishments in Australia Category:Educational institutions disestablished in 1932
title: St Aidan's Theological College, Ballarat
